#summary Contains Utility methods used throughout the Framework.  These Utilities currently provide functionality to Merge two objects, Detect/create a div element with a given id and serialize and object into a queryString.


= {{{Social.Utils }}} =
Extends Social
Contains Utility methods used throughout the Framework.
<wiki:toc />
== Details ==
*Defined in:* clientapi\newDoc.js






== Methods ==

=== {{{Social.Utils.ContainsDiv <static>  -> object }}} ===
Searched for an element in the DOM with a given id and is then returned. If no element is found, a div element is created, appended to the DOM and then is returned.





==== Examples ====
{{{
Social.Utils.ContainsDiv("divIt"); // Returns an element on the DOM with the id.
}}}


==== Parameters ====
|| *Type* || *Name* || *Additional Info* || *Description* ||
|| string || id ||  || The element id to search for. ||


==== Returns ====
|| *Type* || *Name* || *Description* ||
|| object ||  || A DOM element with the given id. ||

----
=== {{{Social.Utils.Merge <static>  -> object }}} ===
Merges two Objects into one.





==== Examples ====
{{{
var a = {"key01":"This is the first key", "key03":"This is the third key"};var b = {"key01":"This is indeed the first key", "key02":"This is the second key"};var i = Social.Utils.Merge(a, b);console.log(i);		// returns {	//	"key01":"This is indeed the first key", 	//	"key02":"This is the second key", 	//	"key03":"This is the third key"	// };
}}}


==== Parameters ====
|| *Type* || *Name* || *Additional Info* || *Description* ||
|| object || objOrg ||  || The original object that you with to merge to. ||
|| object || objNew ||  || The new object that you with to merge the original object with. (Contains updated data) ||


==== Returns ====
|| *Type* || *Name* || *Description* ||
|| object ||  || A new Object that is the product of the two that were passed into the method. ||

----
=== {{{Social.Utils.URLBuilder <static>  -> string }}} ===
Converts an object into a QueryString. (Object must be written in Object Literal Notation)





==== Examples ====
{{{
var i = {	Name: "Peter",	Age: 7,	Home: "Neverland"};Social.Utils.URLBuilder(i); // Returns "name=peter&age=7&home=neverland"
}}}


==== Parameters ====
|| *Type* || *Name* || *Additional Info* || *Description* ||
|| object || obj ||  || The object that will be converted to a queryString. ||


==== Returns ====
|| *Type* || *Name* || *Description* ||
|| string ||  || A queryString version of the Object passed in. ||

----
